metadata.title: CVE-2024-38388 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ALSA:hda/cs_dsp_ctl: Use private_free for control cleanup Use the controlprivate_free callback to free the associated data block. This ensures thatthe memory won't leak, whatever way the control gets destroyed. Theoriginal implementation didn't actually remove the ALSA controls inhda_cs_dsp_control_remove(). It only freed the internal tracking structure.This meant it was possible to remove/unload the amp driver while leavingits ALSA controls still present in the soundcard. Obviously attempting toaccess them could cause segfaults or at least dereferencing stale pointers.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-38388` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
